content.title: Planck Pressure: The Maximum Meaningful Pressure in Physics
content.abstract: The Planck pressure P_P = c⁷/(ℏG²) ≈ 4.63 × 10¹¹³ Pa is the maximum pressure that classical physics can describe. It is equivalent to the Planck energy density and represents the equation of state P = ρc² at Planck density.

statement.text: The Planck pressure is the pressure exerted by matter at Planck density, representing the maximum meaningful pressure in classical physics.

alternate_forms.from_density: P_P = ρ_P c² (relativistic equation of state)

explanation.intuition: Pressure is force per area. At Planck scales, forces are so strong and areas so small that pressure reaches unimaginable values. The pressure at the center of a neutron star (~10³⁵ Pa) is still 10⁷⁸ times weaker than Planck pressure! At P_P, matter is compressed to Planck density and spacetime itself breaks down.
explanation.key_insight: Planck pressure equals Planck energy density because P = E/V for radiation-like matter (equation of state P = ρc² when ρ = ρ_P). This is the equation of state of 'stiff matter'—the maximum stiffness allowed by causality (sound speed = c).
explanation.technical_details: Derivation: P_P = ρ_P c² = (c⁵/(ℏG²)) × c² = c⁷/(ℏG²). Numerical: P_P = (3×10⁸)⁷/((1.055×10⁻³⁴)(6.674×10⁻¹¹)²) = 2.19×10⁵⁶/(4.70×10⁻⁵⁶) = 4.63×10¹¹³ Pa. In natural units [c=G=ℏ=1]: pressure has dimensions of [mass/length³] = [1/length⁴] → P_P = 1/ℓ_P⁴ = 1. Equivalence to energy density: [P] = [Force/Area] = [Energy/Volume] = [u], so P_P = u_P.
common_misconceptions: WRONG: 'Planck pressure can be achieved in lab' — It's 10⁷⁸ × neutron star core
WRONG: 'Planck pressure is infinite' — It's finite but enormous; 4.6 × 10¹¹³ Pa
WRONG: 'Higher pressures are possible' — Classical description fails beyond P_P
CORRECT: 'P_P is where matter compresses to Planck density' — Maximum classical pressure

physical_significance.maximum_pressure: Classical mechanics cannot describe P > P_P
physical_significance.equation_of_state: P = ρc² is 'stiff matter'—maximum stiffness (v_sound = c)
physical_significance.early_universe: During Planck epoch, P ~ P_P throughout universe
physical_significance.black_hole_interior: Pressure approaching P_P signals GR breakdown
